Name: Seoul Capital Area
Description: The metropolitan area surrounding Seoul, the capital city, which is the political, economic, and cultural heart of South Korea.

Name: Gyeonggi Province
Description: Surrounding Seoul, Gyeonggi is South Korea s most populous province, home to key cities like Suwon and Incheon.

Name: Busan
Description: South Korea s second-largest city, located on the southeastern coast, known for its beaches, ports, and seafood.

Name: Daegu
Description: An inland city in southeastern South Korea, known for its textile industry and historical landmarks.

Name: Incheon
Description: A major port city near Seoul, Incheon is known for its international airport and growing economy.

Name: Gwangju
Description: A southwestern city known for its democratic history and arts scene.

Name: Daejeon
Description: A central city known for its high-tech industry and research institutions.

Name: Ulsan
Description: A major industrial city, home to Hyundai s largest automotive and shipbuilding facilities.

Name: Jeju Province
Description: A popular tourist destination known for its volcanic landscapes, beaches, and unique culture.
